poem.title: A Day Job
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: He'll coax them into the close, whose wattage Cloaks more than it shows: Two coats of emulsion, coarse as cabbage. The back courts? A midden. One quotes the prospectus: colts in the paddocks, Croaks in the pond. No fungus. Not that he coasts along with this, of course. Let's say he copes.
